August 25, 2011 POLICYMATTER: TECH (86/2011) 'Decision taken on File No. NHAI/12011/GM(N-1)/ NS-35/2005 /Pt:) Sub: Price adjustment in Item Rate Contracts of NHAL_reg: References has been  received from  Project  Implementation Units   (PIUs) seeking clarification whether while calculating the adjustment a8 per 'Price Adjustment   formula" (generally Clause 70.3 of the Contract   Agreement), the transportation charges are to be included in cost of materials in calculation of actual percentage to govern the adjustment for bitumen(Pb) cement(Pc) steel(Pa) and other items for execution of work a8 per IPC for that month or not; The Contract Agreement typically envisages the following percentage to govern the adjustment of the contract 1. Labour Pl 20% 2 Plant and Machinery and Spares PP 20% 3 POL Pf 10% 4 Bitumen-Pb x% 5. Cement Pc y% 6 Steel Ps 2% 7. Other materials Pm 50-(x+y+z) % Total 100% The x Y, z are the actual percentage of material viz; bitumen, cement and steel respectively used for execution of work a8 per the Interim Payment Certificate for the month which is based, exclusively on the base rate and indices, prevailing 28 days (or one month in some contracts) to closing date of submission of bids. Accordingly, the issue has been examined and it is clarified that the cost of transportation of material should not be included for working out the percentage of Cement; Steel and Bitumen component of work in calculating the adjustment for these materials as per the provisions of the Agreements contd. 22 NHAL price price used price prior price
